Detailed Description

Implements a GATI server for the MMI Simulator.

GatiServer * MmiSimServer::CreateInstance (   )  [static]
 

Returns a new instance of internal handler class, which implements the GatiServer interface.

a pointer to a new GatiServer handler instance.

a reference to singleton MmiSimServer instance.

void MmiSimServer::SetBacklightState (  BOOLEAN  state,
INT  backlight_idx = 0
) 
 

This method has to be called every time the backlight state has changed in order to send all connected clients the new backlight state.

Parameters:
state[in] : the state of the backlight
state[in] : the index of the backlight changed

void MmiSimServer::SetClipState (  BOOLEAN  state  ) 
 

This method has to be called every time the clip/flap state has changed in order to send all connected clients the new clip/flap state.

Parameters:
state[in] : the state of the clip/flap

void MmiSimServer::SetLedState (  BOOLEAN  state,
UINT32  color,
INT  led_idx = 0
) 
 

This method has to be called every time the led state has changed in order to send all connected clients the new led state and color.

Parameters:
state[in] : the state of the led
state[in] : the color of the led
state[in] : the index of the led changed

void MmiSimServer::SetPowerState (  BOOLEAN  state,
INT  display_idx
) 
 

This method has to be called every time the power state of a display has changed in order to send all connected clients the new power state.

Parameters:
state[in] : the display power state
display_idx[in] : the system index of the affected display

void MmiSimServer::SetVibrationState (  BOOLEAN  state  ) 
 

This method has to be called every time the vibration state has changed in order to send all connected clients the new vibration state.

Parameters:
state[in] : the state of the vibrator

void MmiSimServer::UpdateDisplay (  const Rect &  blit_rect,
INT  display_idx
) 
 

This method has to be called every time a display has been updated in order to send all connected clients the display change.

Parameters:
blit_rect[in] : the bounding rectangle which was updated on the display
display_idx[in] : the system index of the display which was updated
